channel.title: Installation :: Better BibTeX for Zotero
channel.description: Install by downloading the latest release – if you use Firefox, make sure to right-click and save the XPI file, not just clicking it – and then in Zotero: In the main menu go to Tools > Add-ons Select ‘Plugins’ Click on the gear in the top-right corner and choose ‘Install Add-on From File…’ Choose .xpi that you’ve just downloaded, click ‘Install’ If you’re using Zotero 6, restart Zotero. Installation in Zotero 7 requires no restart. After the initial installation, the plugin will auto-update to newer releases, so you should need to perform the process described here only once.

item.title: Citation keys
item.description: The Better BibTeX Configuration can be found under the regular Zotero preferences pane, tab ‘Better BibTeX’. The configuration of Better BibTeX is a little baroque compared to the standard Zotero Bib(La)TeX exporters (which only have hidden preferences). The defaults should just work, but here’s an attempt to describe what they do. Making any change here will drop your entire export cache. This is usually not a problem unless you have a really large library, but you can read about what is involved here.
